thread.title: 3-1 lead has Royals fans tweeting confidently
thread.title_full: 3-1 lead has Royals fans tweeting confidently | Toronto Star

title: 3-1 lead has Royals fans tweeting confidently
text:
It ain’t over ‘til it’s over.
Yogi Berra said that – but it’s also what Blue Jays fans are telling each other as Toronto fights to stay alive against the Kansas City Royals.
Down 3-1 in their AL Championship Series ahead of Game 5 later today – the first pitch will be thrown at 4:07 p.m. at Rogers Centre – the Jays’ post-season hopes are on the line.
“Being backed against the wall is nothing but an opportunity to start something great,” Jays right fielder Jose Bautista wrote on Twitter Tuesday night after the Royals’ bats propelled them to a decisive 14-2 win.
Kansas City fans are confident their team is about to make a second-straight World Series appearance and secure the American League championship title.
But Jays fans are holding out hope that Toronto can make a fairy tale comeback and reverse the outcome of the 1985 series between these two teams , which saw the Royals beat the Jays in the ALCS after being down – you guessed it – 3-1.
Marco Estrada will be on the mound for the Jays today as they try to save their season. If Toronto can prolong the series, David Price is expected for Game 6 and Marcus Stroman will pitch Game 7.
